meanings.sent1: Tommy is always getting into trouble at school because he hangs out with a bunch of prats.
meanings.sent2: Don't listen to those prats, they don't know what they're talking about.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a group of prats who kept making silly mistakes.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a prat when she realized she had been wearing her shirt inside out all day.
meanings.sent5: The movie portrayed the main character as a lovable prat who always managed to mess things up.

meanings.definition: To behave in a stupid or foolish manner.
meanings.sent1: Stop pratsing around and focus on your work!
meanings.sent2: He tends to prats when he's nervous and doesn't know what to say.
meanings.sent3: The children began to prats by pretending to be superheroes in the playground.
meanings.sent4: She felt embarrassed when she realized she had been pratsing in front of her crush.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's act involved pratsing about on stage and making funny faces.

meanings.sent1: After sitting on the hard bench for hours, his prats were sore.
meanings.sent2: She slipped on the wet floor and landed right on her prats.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he tried to grab his own prats during diaper change.
meanings.sent4: The cyclist felt the impact on his prats as he hit a bump on the road.
meanings.sent5: The old man chuckled and patted his prats affectionately before sitting down.
